key_issues: Here are the main legal issues extracted from the document:
• Admissibility of Family Settlement as evidence in rectification application under Trade Marks Act 1999.
• Territorial exclusivity of trade marks and its implications for coexistence agreements between family members.
• Effect of family settlement on prior trade mark registrations and pending litigation.
• Competing claims to exclusive rights, title, and ownership in the trade mark "PUNJAB KESARI".
• Jurisdictional disputes over territorial divisions of Uttar Pradesh mentioned in the family settlement agreement.
• Validity and enforceability of agreements on territorial coexistence and trade mark use between family members.
• Rectification of trade mark registration under Section 47 of the Trade Marks Act 1999.
• Interference with existing trademark registrations due to proposed rectification order.
metadata.decision_summary:
**Case Summary: The Hind Samachar Limited vs Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. & Ors.**

**Background:**
The case involves a dispute between two family members of the VKC group (comprising of defendants 1 to 12) over the ownership and use of the trade mark "PUNJAB KESARI". The plaintiff, The Hind Samachar Limited, sought rectification of the registration of the trade mark maintained by the Registrar of Trademarks by cancelling the registration granted to Respondent 1 (one of the defendants), who claims exclusive rights over the trade mark.

**Legal Issues:**

1. **Rectification of Trade Mark Registration**: The plaintiff sought cancellation of the registration of the trade mark under Sections 47 and 57 of the Trade Marks Act, 1999.
2. **Conflict over Trade Mark Ownership**: The dispute revolves around the ownership of the trade mark "PUNJAB KESARI" between two family members.

**Arguments:**

For the plaintiff (The Hind Samachar Limited):
* argued that Respondent 1 (one of the defendants) had obtained registration of the trade mark through fraudulent and deceitful means
* requested rectification of the registration to protect their rights and prevent further misuse

For the Respondent (Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. & Ors.):
* argued that they have used the trade mark for over 2 decades without any opposition or objection from the plaintiff
* produced a Memorandum of Family Settlement, dated July 16, 2022, which demarcates territories for use of the subject mark between the VKC group and AKC group (comprising the defendants)

**Court Findings:**

1. **Memorandum of Family Settlement**: The Court considered the Memorandum of Family Settlement produced by the Respondent, dated July 16, 2022.
2. **Rectification of Trade Mark Registration**: Upon perusal of the record and after considering submissions from both parties, the Court noted that there is no evidence to suggest fraud or deceit on behalf of the Respondent.

**Decision:**
In view of the Memorandum of Family Settlement and considering the lack of evidence supporting the plaintiff's claim of fraudulent registration, the Court was inclined to dispose of the case in terms of the settlement. The Court further directed rectification of the Register of Trade Marks by restricting the trade mark "PUNJAB KESARI" registered under Trademark No. 3353424 dated September 2, 2016 in favor of Respondent 1 (one of the defendants) for specific territories as demarcated in the Memorandum of Family Settlement.

**Outcome:**
The Court ultimately allowed IA 21222/2022 and disposed of CO (COMM.IPD-TM) 285/2021 by directing rectification of the Register of Trade Marks according to the terms of the Memorandum of Family Settlement.

**Source:** Hind Samachar Limited v. Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. And Ors (2022/DHC/005589)

This document is a court case decision from the High Court of Delhi, related to trademark disputes between two media groups: Hind Samachar Limited and Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd.

**Facts:**

* The matter concerns a family settlement agreement dated September 2000, which divided territories for using the mark "PUNJAB KESARI" between the two parties.
* The agreement specified exclusive rights to certain areas in Delhi, Uttarakhand, Madhya Pradesh, Chattisgarh, Assam, and Haryana (except for specific districts), among others.

**Arguments:**

* Petitioner Hind Samachar sought rectification of the Register of Trade Marks to restrict the mark's use by Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd in certain territories.
* Respondent Punjab Kesari argued that they have exclusive rights to use the mark "PUNJAB KESARI" in the specified areas.

**Decisions:**

* The court has accepted the family settlement agreement as a valid basis for dividing the territories between the two parties.
* The court has directed the rectification of the Register of Trade Marks in accordance with the Memorandum dated 16th July 2022, restricting Punjab Kesari's use of the mark "PUNJAB KESARI" to specified areas.

**Parties:**

* Petitioner: Hind Samachar Limited
* Respondent: Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd and others

**Dates:**

* 2000: Family settlement agreement was signed.
* 16th July 2022: Memorandum dated seeking rectification of the Register of Trade Marks.

This document can be found in its entirety on the link provided, which is a PDF file named "Hind Samachar Limited V. Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. And Ors.pdf".

* Para 9.2 mentions VKC Group retains exclusive rights to the mark in Punjab, Haryana (except specified districts), Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, and other territories.
* These territories were listed as per their status in the year 2000 and any subdivisions since then.

Note: No financial amounts are mentioned on this page.

**Decision and Orders Section of Case Document**

Source: Hind Samachar Limited V. Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. And Ors.pdf (41)

**Case Summary**

The Delhi High Court disposed of the case between Hind Samachar Limited (Plaintiff) and Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. and others (Defendants).

**Background**

* The Plaintiff, VKC Group, owned the trademark No. 3353424 but allowed its use in other territories without proper registration.
* Respondent 1 (AKC Group) had been using the mark in violation of this agreement.

**Order**

On December 14, 2022, Justice C. Hari Shankar passed an order:

* Directed the rectification/amendment of the disputed trademark's registration to restrict its use to specific territories mentioned in para 4.
* Permitted the parties to withdraw any ongoing oppositions or objections related to the mark.
* Gave the parties permission to complete any formalities required for the implementation of this order.

**Key Points**

* Case number: C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 285/2021
* Neutral Citation Number: 2022/DHC/005589
* Date of decision: December 14, 2022
* Parties involved:
	+ Hind Samachar Limited (Plaintiff/VKC Group)
	+ Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. and others (Defendants/AKC Group)

**Legally binding nature**

The order was binding, as the parties agreed to its terms and were directed to take certain actions to implement it.

This summary highlights the key aspects of the Decision and Orders section in the provided case document from PDF 41.

**Case Summary**

The case is **Hind Samachar Limited v. Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. And Ors.** (2022/DHC/005589).

**Key Facts:**

* The dispute involved trade mark registration (No. 3353424) for the mark "Hind Samachar".
* The petitioner (VKC Group) and respondent (AKC Group) agreed to restrict use of the mark to certain territories.
* The judge ordered rectification/amendment of the trade mark registration to reflect this restriction.

**Proceedings:**

* Court case CO (COMM.IPD-TM) 285/2021 was filed by Hind Samachar Limited against Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. and others.
* A petition was made for disposal in terms agreed upon by both parties.

**Decision:**

* The dispute is resolved, as agreed upon by the parties, with a restriction on use of the trade mark to specific territories.
* Any pending oppositions or objections will be withdrawn.
* Formalities may need to be completed for implementation of this order.

**Dates:**

* December 14, 2022 (order date)
* September 2, 2016 (date of trade mark registration)

**Source:** The Hind Samachar Limited v. Punjab Kesari Publishers Pvt. Ltd. And Ors.pdf (Delhi High Court case document).
